Posts.Content: sweetjolieblon wrote: Had microcalcification change noted during routine screening-to linear and branching.  Had diagnostic mammo done which led to stereotactic bipopsy with following path report.  To have excison hopefully with clean margin.  The report reads as follows: DIAGNOSIS:  Right breast, anterior depth, core biopsy:  consistent atypical hyperplasia bordering on ductal carcinoma in situ, ADH is seen in two ducts on separate slides. Focally associated with calcification.  Flat epithelial atypia.  Please refer to comment. COMMENT:  One of the ducts is seen at the edge of the core, is partially filled with atypical cells with visible nucleoli and no definite necrosis. One atypical mitosis is seen.  The histopathological features are worrisome for ductal carcinoma in situ, however spindle cells are identified admixed with atypical cells and the focus is very small measuring 0.24mm all precluding a diagnosis of carcinoma.  Recommend appropriate follow up and complete removal of the lesion if clinically warranted. Does this rule out DCIS? Joan Dx 3/18/2011, IDC, <1cm, Stage IB, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: need help understanding path report sweetjolieblon VSM

Posts.Content: sweetjolieblon wrote: Briefly, I had IDC stage 1 (not in nodes), grade 3, triple negative.  Bilateral mastectomy with reconstruction now with silicone implants.  I had chemo April 13-July 27.  Taxotere and Cytoxan/Neulasta for six cycles.  I am so thankful I did not have a lot of problems with the chemo.  My labs were always at normal by the next cycle.  I did have nausea, very tired, feeling lousy but always bounced back.  Dr and Nurses all happy.  Over a month ago I started realizing I had a problem with vision.  I had a blurry spot that comes and goes and it affects both eyes.  I also started having irregular heartbeat, difficultly sometimes with wordfinding and brief episodes confusion (for minute I was not able to figure out how to open the door on our vehicle to get out-duh).  NEVER had these before the chemo.  I did relate to my onc that after my 1st chemo had episode when I could not see where I was going-had to feel my way to the bathroom.  Dark and blotchy.  Lingered for some time with the first, brief with second but none after.  He didnt seem to concerned though he thought it odd. Finally went to my primary doc.  Ordered MRI of brain (looks great-no evidence of stroke etc).  Saw cardiologist.  Had echo, thalium stress, ekg showed pvc.  Stress showed polymorphic pvc's increasing on exertion. Had a heart cath.  Negative for blockage (thank goodness!!).  Started me on Atenolol for the pvc's.  The blurry spot that comes and goes is an optical aura (some have them without migraine, many with).  I do not have headaches so I just have the aura.  No one knows what triggered this stuff.  My cardiologist did say my pvc's were not caused by stress.  My opthalmologist says sometimes the body shows us stuff before something develops.  Well, all this, I know, is trivial from what many of you are going through.  I am sincerely thankful I have come through so well.  I just wonder if anyone else has any of these things happen post chemo.  Thanks in advance.  Joan Dx 3/18/2011, IDC, <1cm, Stage IB, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Are these possible side effects? sweetjolieblon sweetjolieblon
